title: `get` fails on unavailable subdataset with incomprehensible message

labels.name: fix-implemented
labels.description: A fix is available, but has not been merged or released, yet.

body:
````
% datalad -l debug get raw/structural
[DEBUG  ] Resolved input path arguments: ['/tmp/tnt/raw/structural'] 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/code/ofhelpers 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/phase1 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/phase2 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/structural 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/structural 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/structural 
[INFO   ] Installing subdataset <Dataset path=/tmp/tnt/raw/structural> 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/structural 
[DEBUG  ] Retrieving a dataset from URL: /home/mih/forrest/collection/tnt/raw/structural 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to retrieve from URL: /home/mih/forrest/collection/tnt/raw/structural 
[DEBUG  ] Retrieving a dataset from URL: /home/mih/forrest/collection/structural 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to retrieve from URL: /home/mih/forrest/collection/structural 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/structural 
[WARNING] Target /tmp/tnt/raw/structural already exists and is not an installed dataset. Skipped. 
[DEBUG  ] Original failure:
| Cmd('/usr/lib/git-annex.linux/git') failed due to: exit code(128)
|   cmdline: /usr/lib/git-annex.linux/git clone -v /home/mih/forrest/collection/structural /tmp/tnt/raw/structural
|   stderr: 'fatal: repository '/home/mih/forrest/collection/structural' does not exist
| ' [cmd.py:wait:291] 
[DEBUG  ] Update cloned subdataset <Dataset path=/tmp/tnt/raw/structural> in parent 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/structural 
[DEBUG  ] Failed to detect a valid repo at /tmp/tnt/raw/structural 
[ERROR  ] 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'get_active_branch' [utils.py:_install_subds_from_flexible_source:223] (AttributeError) 
````

The actual issue is that the subdataset has a relative path "URL" and is not available at the location of `origin`.

Solution will come as part of #1468
